intro: Copaifera copaibo, commonly known as copaiba, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree produces a valuable resin known as copaiba balsam, which is used in traditional medicine and perfumery. Its bark and wood are also utilized for their aromatic properties and durability. Copaifera copaibo plays an important role in the ecological balance of its habitat and is a key species in the biodiversity of the region.
